SECRET
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 4th JUNE, 1918.
1. Yesterday the Germans launched many attacks on the western side of the salient especially between TORCY and GANDELU, between TROESNES and FAVEROLLES, and to the west of SOISSONS. There has also been considerable fighting west of SOISSONS. An attempt made by a German battalion to cross the MARNE near JAULGONNE failed.
Our line now runs approximately as follows :- between RHEIMS and CHATEAU-THIERRY no change, south of CHATEAU-THIERRY from the north bank of the MARNE at AULNOIS - BOIS DE LA MARETTE - west of BOURESCHES - BELLEAU - TORCY - VEUILLY - GANDELU - CHEZY - west of TROESNES - FAVEROLLES - LONGPONT - east of DOMMIERS - west of PERNAN, thence along the southern bank of the AISNE to LEPORT - VINGRE - HAUTE BRAYE - west of MOULIN-SOUS-TOUVENT - south-western slopes of the MONT-DE-CHOISY to our original front line about SEMPIGNY.
2. On the rest of the front there is no change.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
4th June 1918.
issued at 1.0 p.m.
For the personal information - of the Minister only. -
